required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Evaluation of the Percentage of Subjects Who Have Reached Their LDL-C Objectives After Treatment With INEGY (Study P05103)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: PRAGMATIC (This is the True Official Title of the Protocol for This Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to determine the percentage of patients who met the low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) objective with INEGY, that were not under statin monotherapy treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The type of patient sampling used was consecutive patient sampling

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reaching the Targeted LDL-C Levels
primary_outcome.description: A subject was considered to have met targeted LDL-C levels (been controlled) if: subject had no cardiovascular (CV) risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 2.2 g/L, subject had only 1 CV risk factor and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.9 g/L, subject had 2 CV risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.6 g/L, subject had 3 or more CV risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.3 g/L, subject had a high CV risk and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1 g/L.

arm_group.description: Subjects suffering from primary hypercholesterolemia that are not controlled by statins as a monotherapy, and are treated with INEGY

intervention.description: Ezetimibe 10mg - Simvastatine 20 mg or 40 mg; Tablet - OD; Patient currently treated for INEGY for at least 4 weeks

study_pop.textblock: Subjects suffering from primary hypercholesterolemia that are not controlled by statins as a monotherapy, and are treated with INEGY

group.title: Subjects Treated With INEGY
group.description: Subjects suffering from primary hypercholesterolemia that were not adequately controlled by statins as a monotherapy, and were treated with INEGY. INEGY is composed of a combination of ezetimibe (10 mg) and simvastatin (20 or 40 mg). The dosage of the study treatment is one tablet per day ezetimibe/simvastatin (10 mg/20 mg or 10 mg/40 mg).

participants_list.participants: This safety population (SAF)analysed consisted of all patients who took at least one tablet of INEGY

group.title: Subjects Treated With INEGY
group.description: Subjects suffering from primary hypercholesterolemia that were not adequately controlled by statins as a monotherapy, and were treated with INEGY. INEGY is composed of a combination of ezetimibe (10 mg) and simvastatin (20 or 40 mg). The dosage of the study treatment is one tablet per day ezetimibe/simvastatin (10 mg/20 mg or 10 mg/40 mg).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reaching the Targeted LDL-C Levels
outcome.description: A subject was considered to have met targeted LDL-C levels (been controlled) if: subject had no cardiovascular (CV) risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 2.2 g/L, subject had only 1 CV risk factor and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.9 g/L, subject had 2 CV risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.6 g/L, subject had 3 or more CV risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.3 g/L, subject had a high CV risk and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1 g/L.
outcome.population: This was the efficacy population per protocol (PP) targeted for study treatment, and consisted of patients having taken INEGY at least once, with a primary efficacy criterion available (presence of risk factors or not plus lipid assessment after introduction of INEGY), and showing no major deviations from the protocol.

group.title: Subjects Treated With INEGY
group.description: Subjects suffering from primary hypercholesterolemia that were not adequately controlled by statins as a monotherapy, and were treated with INEGY. INEGY is composed of a combination of ezetimibe (10 mg) and simvastatin (20 or 40 mg). The dosage of the study treatment is one tablet per day ezetimibe/simvastatin (10 mg/20 mg or 10 mg/40 mg).

measure.title: Number of Participants Reaching the Targeted LDL-C Levels
measure.description: A subject was considered to have met targeted LDL-C levels (been controlled) if: subject had no cardiovascular (CV) risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 2.2 g/L, subject had only 1 CV risk factor and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.9 g/L, subject had 2 CV risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.6 g/L, subject had 3 or more CV risk factors and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1.3 g/L, subject had a high CV risk and level of LDL-C after initiating INEGY was lower than 1 g/L.
measure.population: This was the efficacy population per protocol (PP) targeted for study treatment, and consisted of patients having taken INEGY at least once, with a primary efficacy criterion available (presence of risk factors or not plus lipid assessment after introduction of INEGY), and showing no major deviations from the protocol.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events were recorded from the introduction of INEGY to the first assessment after introduction of INEGY

group.title: Subjects Treated With INEGY
group.description: Subjects suffering from primary hypercholesterolemia that were not adequately controlled by statins as a monotherapy, and were treated with INEGY. INEGY is composed of a combination of ezetimibe (10 mg) and simvastatin (20 or 40 mg). The dosage of the study treatment is one tablet per day ezetimibe/simvastatin (10 mg/20 mg or 10 mg/40 mg).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The results of this non-interventional study can be published or presented by members of the scientific committee after revision and agreement by Schering-Plough, and in such a way that the confidential information and industrial property are not revealed. Before publication or presentation, a copy of the final text must be sent by the member(s) of the scientific committee to Schering-Plough for comment.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
